name: Readability
author: Piotr Sochalewski

sections.description:
Plugin which lets you to show posts in stylish, legible pop-up window, like in Safari.

Please report bugs in comments [here]http://wolnaelekcja.pl/wp-readability/) (I speak English and Polish, so be polite and use on of them) and don’t forget about donate if you really like this plugin. ðŸ™‚
sections.installation:
1. Upload folder named readability to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.changelog:
0.1.3

  • Fix for wide images

0.1.2

  • Headers are aligned to left instead of justified
  • Stylish lists (ordered and unordered)
  • More “normalize” hacks

0.1.1

  • Quotations are nice now (and looks like quotations instead of just para)
  • Updated style for anchors too

0.1

  • First stable release with implemented settings

0.1-beta9

  • Stylish headings

0.1-beta8

  • Minor fix, but it could be important

0.1-beta7

  • Better CSS for pictures

0.1-beta6

  • Everything works even if you have wp-Typography installed

0.1-beta5

  • Better typography thanks to PHP Typography
  • Fixed CSS

0.1-beta4

  • Added simple space control, which prevents single character words from residing at the end of a line

0.1-beta3

  • Fixed CSS from beta2 wasn’t exactly fixed

0.1-beta2

  • Fixed width in some weird cases

0.1-beta

  • Everything works as should!

0.1-alpha4

  • No conflict with another jQuery plugins

0.1-alpha3

  • Pop-up window is really nice now

0.1-alpha2

  • It works! Sometimes…

0.1-alpha

  • First public, but still developer and alpha release
